output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The buy function always returns zero, which means that the buyer never receives the promised amount.
The sell function uses the random() function, which generates random numbers, and therefore the sold amount will be different every time the function is called.
The freezeAccount function allows the owner to freeze the balance of an arbitrary user, which effectively removes their assets from the contract.
The setPrices function is public and allows anyone to set the prices of the tokens. This means that the owner of the token can change the price of the token at any time.
